title: Box 2.0 OAuth2 Token
description: The Box Token API provides methods to retrieve an access token and revoke an access token. An access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session. In the normal order of operations you will being by requesting authentication from the Box.

sha1.description: The sha1 hash of this file.

FileReference.description: It references either a file or a folder
FileReference.title: FileReference

etag.description:
A unique string identifying the version of this folder.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the /events endpoint.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

ItemReference.description: It references either a file or a folder
ItemReference.title: ItemReference

actions.title: revokeToken
actions.description: This is the URL of the Box revoke endpoint, the endpoint that revokes access tokens, or to put it another way, the endpoint that ends sessions, logging users out.

client_id.description: The client ID of the application requesting authentication.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the application requesting authentication.

actions.title: generateAccessToken
actions.description: This is the URL of the Box token endpoint, the endpoint that returns access tokens. An access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

code.description: The authorization code returned by Box in response to a successfull authentication request.

client_id.description: The client ID of the application requesting authentication.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the application requesting authentication.

refresh_token.description: The refresh_token that is used to get the new access_token

subject_token.description: This is the primary/secondary application token you will exchange for the file token.
